My dear Mr. Kenny, I am afraid that Major Tandy left no record behind of the conversation he had with Schooling while in Basra about financial advice to the Shaikh of Kuwait, which you mentioned to me in your letter of June 16th. 2. It would, of course, be very useful for the Shaikh to be able to turn to expert advice in the matter of his investments, particularly, as I mentioned to Jordan when I was up in Basra the other day, now that the sale of the Neutral Zone Concession has increased his wealth considerably: however, in the absence of any information, I cannot say whether Tandy approached Schooling at the request of the Shaikh or on his own initiative. I am inclined to think almost certainly the latter, as the Shaikh tends to adopt a rather independant attitude in his money matters: and this is a subject on which we cannot press him over much. I feel therefore that this is a matter which we shall have to wait for the Shaikh to raise himself, and meanwhile I will keep your comments in mind and let you know of any further developments. titleInfo.title: 'File 4/36 Shaikh of Kuwait's Assets, Holdings. Royalties Paid to Sheikh'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 16; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-14; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between officials of the Political Agency in Kuwait, the Political Residency in Bahrain and Ottoman Bank regarding the finances of the Ruler of Kuwait, Shaikh Ahmad al-Jaber al-Sabah.The correspondence discusses the Shaikh's financial holdings, royalty payments that he had received from the Kuwait Oil Company and ideas for ways to encourage him to invest in United Kingdom (UK) government bonds, including the appointment of a British financial adviser.
